clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Postoperative Incentive Spirometry on Pulmonary Function and Pulmonary Complications in Bariatric Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Postoperative Incentive Spirometry on Pulmonary Function and Pulmonary Complications in Bariatric Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the omission of incentive spirometry use following bariatric surgery. Half of participants will receive an incentive spirometer while the other half will not. Oxygen saturation and pulmonary complications after surgery will be measured to examine the effectiveness of incentive spirometry.

detailed_description.textblock:
Incentive spirometry is speculated to improve pulmonary function in the postoperative period, though data to support this is lacking. Patients undergoing bariatric surgery are at increased risk for pulmonary compromise as they are obese and undergoing foregut surgery.
This study aims to examine the effect of incentive spirometry after bariatric surgery by performing a prospective randomized trial. Subjects will be randomized to either receive an incentive spirometer or not. The primary outcome measure of oxygen saturation off of supplemental oxygen will be taken preoperatively and at 6,12, and 24 hours postoperatively. Secondary outcome measures include rate of pulmonary complications, and time to wean off of supplemental oxygen.

primary_outcome.description: Number of subjects with pulse oximetry reading of < 92% with subject off of supplemental oxygen for 5 minutes with head of bed at 30°, 6 hours postoperative.
Number of subjects with pulse oximetry reading of < 92% with subject off of supplemental oxygen for 5 minutes with head of bed at 30°, 12 hours postoperative.
Number of subjects with pulse oximetry reading of < 92% with subject off of supplemental oxygen for 5 minutes with head of bed at 30°, 24 hours postoperative.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: entire inpatient say, usually 1 to 7 days
secondary_outcome.description: atelectasis found on chest imaging, pneumonia, or re intubation

arm_group.description: Incentive spirometry 10 times per hour while awake

intervention.description: Incentive spirometer is provided to the patient, this is the current standard of care, and is the control arm.
No incentive spirometer is provided to the patient, this is the study arm.
